summary: Results-driven reservoir engineer with extensive experience in reservoir management, enhanced oil recovery, reserve evaluation, integrated reservoir modeling, compositional simulation, economic analysis, geomechanics, and project management. Fluent in English and French; experienced in collaborating with professionals of different technical and cultural backgrounds.
skills: Knowledge in SEC reserves estimation concepts
Enhanced oil recovery (waterflooding, CO2 injection, WAG, polymer flood)
Reservoir geology and depositional system fundamentals

experience.title: Consultant
experience.description: Feasibility study of CO2 storage and wastewater disposal into the Lawson Formation in Polk County, Florida. Develop semi-analytical equations to estimate CO2 storage efficiency and pressure changes at the wellbore. Conduct fluid flow and geochemical simulations of CO2 and municipal wastewater injection. Evaluate geomechanical effects of fluid injection into the Lawson formation.

experience.title: Reservoir Engineer
experience.description: Investigator for miscible and immiscible CO2 EOR pilots. Fields: Mumford Hills (Clore sandstone) and Sugar Creek (Jackson sandstone). Worked with geoscience and engineering staff to develop models, collect input data for compositional simulations, calibrate reservoir models to field observations, estimate reserves and forecast production, and evaluate the viability of field development scenarios and new drilling locations.

experience.title: Investigator
experience.description: Miscible and immiscible CO2 EOR pilots for Mumford Hills and Sugar Creek; contributed to model development and data synthesis for compositional simulations.

experience.title: Development of dimensionless performance curves
experience.description: Developed dimensionless performance curves for Aux Vases, Cypress, and Ste. Genevieve formations; performed history-matching reservoir models; designed 5-spot patterns for multiple fields; conducted miscible and immiscible CO2 and water-alternate-CO2 injections; generated dimensionless curves to evaluate EOR performance.

experience.title: Principal Investigator
experience.description: Depositional environment and storage efficiency project. Define, plan, monitor, and modify project; evaluate progress using MS Project; collaborate with sedimentary geologists, geostatisticians, engineers, and field operators to develop geologic and geocellular models; mentor reservoir modeling staff; develop simulation workflow; manage reservoir modeling tasks; design and manage development of an access database tool for analyzing simulation results.

experience.title: Post-Doctoral Research Engineer
experience.description: Coupled CO2 EOR-geomechanics simulation study (Aneth Field, Paradox Basin, Utah).
